channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Virginia Democrats show map to counter Trump redistricting but its future is unclear
item.description: The new map still requires approval from the courts and the voters but, if enacted, it could help Democrats win four more House seats
item.content:encoded:
The new map still requires approval from the courts and the voters but, if enacted, it could help Democrats win four more House seats

(Image credit: Shaban Athuman)
item.dc:creator: Jahd Khalil

item.title: FBI says it's taking ransom notes 'seriously' in Nancy Guthrie's disappearance
item.description: In the search for Nancy Guthrie, law enforcement says they are investigating ransom notes that were sent to media.
item.content:encoded: In the search for Nancy Guthrie, law enforcement says they are investigating ransom notes that were sent to media.
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Day 5 of search for Nancy Guthrie: 'We still believe Nancy is still out there'
item.description: The FBI is offering a reward of up to $50,000 for information leading to the recovery of Guthrie and/or the arrest and conviction of anyone involved in her disappearance.
item.content:encoded:
The FBI is offering a reward of up to $50,000 for information leading to the recovery of Guthrie and/or the arrest and conviction of anyone involved in her disappearance.

(Image credit: Jan Sonnenmair)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Homan to draw down agents in Minnesota. And, U.S.-Russia nuclear arms deal expires
item.description: U.S. border czar Tom Homan says 700 federal agents will be leaving Minnesota. And, the New START Treaty between the U.S. and Russia expired today.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. border czar Tom Homan says 700 federal agents will be leaving Minnesota. And, the New START Treaty between the U.S. and Russia expired today.

(Image credit: Charly Triballeau)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: The Winter Olympics get 8 new events, including the first new sport in decades
item.description: Ski mountaineering will make its Olympic debut this year, the first winter sport to do so since 2002. Skeleton, luge, ski jumping and moguls are also getting new events.
item.content:encoded:
Ski mountaineering will make its Olympic debut this year, the first winter sport to do so since 2002. Skeleton, luge, ski jumping and moguls are also getting new events.

(Image credit: Antonio Calanni)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Team USA settles in to athletes' villages, 'smash' pizzas
item.description: U.S. Olympic athletes are arriving and settling into their digs for the next couple of weeks in Italy. Curlers are amazed by the mountain scenery in Cortina; figure skaters are plant fostering in Milan; and the big air slopestyle women are "smashing pizzas" in Livigno.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. Olympic athletes are arriving and settling into their digs for the next couple of weeks in Italy. Curlers are amazed by the mountain scenery in Cortina; figure skaters are plant fostering in Milan; and the big air slopestyle women are "smashing pizzas" in Livigno.

(Image credit: Alessandro Trovati)
item.dc:creator: Pien Huang

item.title: The Trump administration is reducing the number of federal agents in Minnesota by 700
item.description: The Trump administration is reducing the number of immigration officers in Minnesota by 700, but there's still no end date for the surge despite weeks of turmoil and the deaths of two U.S. citizens.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration is reducing the number of immigration officers in Minnesota by 700, but there's still no end date for the surge despite weeks of turmoil and the deaths of two U.S. citizens.
item.dc:creator: Meg Anderson

item.title: Minnesota AG Keith Ellison on withdrawal of federal immigration agents
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel asks Minnesota Attorney General Keith Ellison what concessions leaders in his state are willing to make to secure a further withdrawal of federal immigration agents.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel asks Minnesota Attorney General Keith Ellison what concessions leaders in his state are willing to make to secure a further withdrawal of federal immigration agents.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: How the new dietary guidelines could impact school meals
item.description: Cutting back on ready-to-eat meals won't be easy, and whole milk may make a comeback. One thing that's certain: It'll be a while before the new guidelines trickle down to schools.
item.content:encoded: Cutting back on ready-to-eat meals won't be easy, and whole milk may make a comeback. One thing that's certain: It'll be a while before the new guidelines trickle down to schools.
item.dc:creator: Kadin Mills

item.title: After historic flooding, Washington residents rebuild and reckon with the future
item.description: In Washington state, over 400 homes were destroyed or sustained major damage from historic flooding in December. We hear about what recovery looks like and how people are thinking about future flood risk.
item.content:encoded: In Washington state, over 400 homes were destroyed or sustained major damage from historic flooding in December. We hear about what recovery looks like and how people are thinking about future flood risk.
item.dc:creator: Casey Martin
